relevant_findings.general: The rest of the general, systemic, and neurologic examination was unremarkable.

relevant_findings.sleep_study: Polysomnogram (PSG) showed mild obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) with significant upper airway resistance syndrome (UARS), mild periodic limb movements of sleep (PLMS) at 7/hour, and generalized spike-wave discharges in non-REM sleep and in wakefulness.
relevant_findings.multiple_sleep_latency_test: MSLT showed sleep onset REM (SOREM) in 2 of the 5 naps and a normal sleep latency of 18 minutes.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Post-tonsillectomy, follow-up PSG showed resolution of the OSA, improved sleep efficiency, and reduced snoring and arousal index.
